result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcos Menez

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Case called at 2:27 PM [Court Reporter: Linda Kasparzak]
Defendant Marcos Menez not in court.  Melanie Flint in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Shawna Stevenoski present to serve as Spanish Interpreter for the Defendant. 

Atty Flint requests warrant. 

The Court authorizes body only, bench warrant. 
recess: 2:29pm
Adjourned initial appearance on August 4, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Conditions of Bond include:  
--not to drive [a motor vehicle]
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--not to use controlled substances without a valid prescription

[MK] case called at 1:17pm 
Defendant Marcos Menez appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (the PD appears for bond purposes only; Attorney Rumpf indicates that Mr. Menez does not currently qualify, however his financial situation may change).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Shawna Stevenoski is sworn as Spanish Interpreter. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel is reviewed. The Court indicates that a petition form to request the appointment of counsel is to be provided to Mr. Menez at the jail, along with the bond paperwork.  
The Court adjourns the Initial Appearance. 
The Court requires a $5,000 Signature Bond with conditions:
--not to drive [a motor vehicle]
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--not to use controlled substances without a valid prescription 
recess 1:25pm. 

NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance (and status of counsel hearing) on August 4th at 1:45pm
